It’s TIME we do it RIGHT for our SKIN Today there are very few true soaps on the market. Most body cleansers, both liquid and solid, are actually synthetic detergent products.Take a look at the list of ingredients for an average bar of soap in your local store. It could contain sodium lauryl sulfate (SLS), an anionic surfactant used in laundry detergent that will dry out and irritate your skin. It may also have sodium laureth sulfate (SLES), a cheap foaming agent that can become contaminated with the suspected carcinogen Dioxane while being manufacturedIf it’s labeled as antibacterial it probably contains triclosan. This chemical is classified as a pesticide by the Environmental Protection Agency. Three quarters of antibacterial liquid soaps and a third of antibacterial bar soaps contain triclosan, which is thought to be contributing to increasing bacterial resistance across the world

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Surprised at how nice and clean it feels after washing. It also has a pleasant nice scent. I want to see how much my skin sours in the summer after I use it. I'm using it in the winter and it works nicely.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great soap and reasonable price
reviews.reviewText: Tried this soap because I had not previously and really enjoy it. Great scent but not overpowering or "chemically" smelling. Gets me clean and I enjoy the mild exfoliating quality. The price is very reasonable for the quality and I like to support small, independent businesses.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice Subtle Smell
reviews.reviewText: I love that the soap is made in America! The soap is made using natural ingredients. The smell is not overwhelming and is very pleasing. The lather action could be improved but with a little grind you can get a nice lather. All in all this is a nice, natural, chemical free soap. Nice size bar that will last longer than a week like most natural soaps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this soap! Smells amazing, patchouly, and lavender! I put it in my shower caddy under my showerhead and it smells of the whole bathroom with great scent. The soap itself is very cleansing. It feels moisturizing, but still squeaky clean once rinsed off This is my second time purchasing, and I will continue to in the future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Ordered two got one
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this product I order it all the time this time I ordered two and only received one kind of disappointed but will continue to order the product but I would really like my other bar of soap

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars You Pay for the “Gormet”
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I had a bad PUPPs rash postpartum. I read Pine Tar soap can help relieve the itch, and this soap could arrive faster than Grandpa’s. I did experience some relief, whether it was the soap or placebo effect, I’m not sure, because I have nothing to compare it to. I’d really give the soap 3.5 stars, but that’s not an option. If you want a simple pine tar soap, I’d suggest looking elsewhere- I found Grandpa's soap cheaper. If you want a “former” soap that’s reminiscent of pine tar, this is a good bet.PROS: The smell is there but mild. It has gentle exfoliation and is moisturizing. It looks nice- it could even be given as a gift.PRO&CON: The directions give you a way to “age” the soap, to make it last longer, but you have to wait a week.CONS: It is super soft- granted, I was taking really long showers to relieve my itch, but this only lasted about 5-6 showers. This was a major con, considering the price. It also left a black residue in my tub.Updated to directly compare with Grandpa’s Soap:PINEY-NESS: Grandpa’s has more pine. This one probably has as much or equal charcoal, creating the black color and the more mild scent.SMELL: Grandpa’s smells like a fire pit after you’ve burned pine. This soap smells like a black Yankee Candle.COST: I got a 3 pack of Grandpa’s for $2 more than I paid for 1 bar of this soap.RESIDUE: Grandpa’s leaves regular soap residue, about what I get with a regular bar of soap. This soap leaves a noticeable black residue with each use.DURABILITY/LONGEVITY: Grandpa’s lasts longer, definitely.LOOK: Grandpa’s looks like a light brown bar of soap. This one is definitely prettier and could be left out as a decorative soap.OVERALL: If you want a decorative soap with some pine tar qualities, go with this one. If you want a “true” pine tar soap, keep shopping.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lavender and Patchouli Scent is Amazing
reviews.reviewText: I like the scent of the combination of lavender and patchouli and plan to buy this again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
